chapter.title: Configuration
chapter.para: The configuration of the rasterization involves the following elements:

listitem.para: Configure the vector tile pipeline to use rasterization

section.title: Dependencies
section.para: Make sure your include the plug-in in your project. If you are using Maven, add the following dependency to your pom:
Rasterization is also dependent on caching, but the dependency is automatically handled. For configuration of the caching plugin, see the plugin documentation.

section.title: Pipeline configuration
section.para: The only pipeline that can optionally use rasterization is the GetVectorTile pipeline used by the VectorLayerService. If you want to use rasterization without extra caching of the complete tile, you can add the following configuration location to your web.xml file:classpath:org/geomajas/plugin/rasterizing/DefaultRasterizedPipelines.xml
If you want to maximize caching, add the following location instead:classpath:org/geomajas/plugin/rasterizing/DefaultCachedAndRasterizedPipelines.xml
Alternatively you can configure for each layer individually which pipeline should be used.
The following rasterized pipelines exist (bean name):

PIPELINE_GET_VECTOR_TILE_RASTERIZED: pipeline to get a tile for a vector layer.
PIPELINE_GET_VECTOR_TILE_CACHED_AND_RASTERIZED: pipeline to get a tile for a vector layer and cache the tile result

section.title: Rasterization moment configuration
section.para: The moment at which rasterization takes place can be globally configured by adding the following to your configuration:

<bean name="plugin.rasterizing.api.rasterizingInfo" class="org.geomajas.plugin.rasterizing.api.RasterizingInfo"> <property name="rasterizingMoment"> <util:constant static-field="org.geomajas.plugin.rasterizing.api.RasterizingMoment.TILE_REQUEST" /> </property> </bean>The default value is RasterizingMoment.TILE_REQUEST, which means that rasterization will already take place when the tile is requested. If you want to postpone rasterization to the stage where the url is requested, you should replace this value by RasterizingMoment.URL_REQUEST.

section.title: Rasterizing service configuration
section.para:
The rasterizing service defaults to a geotools implementation. You can configure the following parameters of this service:
transparent: boolean to indicate that the generated image should be transparent (defaults to true)
renderingHints: this parameter defines an optional map of rendering hints (of class RenderingHints) that are used by the Java Graphics2D class. Each hint consists of a key-value pair
labelBorderDistanceX: distance between label border and text (x-direction)
labelBorderDistanceY: distance between label border and text (y-direction)
style2DFactoryService: service that behaves as a factory for turning configuration styles into geotools styles. This service can be replaced by a custom service, e.g. to convert extensions of current style configuration objects
A custom rasterizing service configuration might look like this:

<bean name="plugin.rasterizing.RasterizingService" class="org.geomajas.plugin.rasterizing.GeotoolsRasterizingService"> <property name="transparent" value="false" /> <property name="renderingHints" ref="renderingHints" /> <property name="labelBorderDistanceX" value="4" /> <property name="labelBorderDistanceY" value="3" /> </bean>
<util:map id="renderingHints" map-class="org.geotools.factory.Hints"> <entry> <key> <util:constant static-field="java.awt.RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING" /> </key> <ref bean="valueAntiAliasOff" /> </entry> </util:map>
<util:constant id="valueAntiAliasOff" static-field="java.awt.RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_OFF" />Note that we have to go through some hoops to configure the rendering hints in xml. Of course, you can always provide your own service implementation by implementing the RasterizingService interface and replacing the bean class in the above configuration.
